Copy-Paste

\n Copying text to your computer's 'clipboard' and pasting it into another location. Copying can be done many ways, including selecting text with your mouse, right-clicking then selecting 'copy', by selecting text and using your computer's 'hotkey' for copying (Either `Ctrl-C` on Windows or `⌘-C` on Mac), or, in the course documents, by clicking on the 'copy' icon in most code chunks. To paste, you can either right-click and select 'Paste', or use your system's 'hotkey' (`Ctrl-V` on Windows, or `⌘-V` on Mac).

Find, or `Ctrl-F`

\n You can find text in most pages or documents by either typing `Ctrl-F` or `⌘-F`, then typing in the text you want to find in the dialogue box that pops up.
